intro: Pentacalia aclydiphylla, commonly known as the stickyleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with stems that branch at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
